blocks.content: Loops are a way to iterate multiple times through a set of questions or tasks. Loops can “embed” any of the step types exiting in the system, marking it highly powerful.

points.text: Choose where you want to put the Loop Step in the orange bar below
Add Loop text to the input field
Add different Input elements into the Loop Step to loop over
Validate the Step by clicking the green tick:

blocks.caption: Under (2.2.1) is a loop to collect two pieces of information, a location and cable run. In this example, users where required to iterate through various on-site locations.

Once done with the first location, a user would enter values for the next location by tapping on “Create Next Iteration” (previous screen). Loops can have a fixed number of iterations or can be infinite. The current number of iterations is displayed in a badge next to the related question or task. In this example, there are two iterations.

blocks.content: You can easily fold and unfold any structural element containing other elements. Simple tap on the arrow on the right of the element cell in the table.
